Conference: 𝗕𝗲𝘆𝗼𝗻𝗱 𝗕𝗼𝗿𝗱𝗲𝗿𝘀 🗓 𝗗𝗮𝘁𝗲: 16.09. - 20.09.2024. 📍 𝗟𝗼𝗰𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻: Bonn, Germany 🗣 𝗪𝗼𝗿𝗸𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗹𝗮𝗻𝗴𝘂𝗮𝗴𝗲: English ⏰ 𝗔𝗽𝗽𝗹𝗶𝗰𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗱𝗲𝗮𝗱𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗲: 15th of May The aim of this conference is to highlight the importance of cooperation between neighboring partner countries and Programme countries, raise awareness about this collaboration, and create connections among various stakeholders. Additionally, the conference will examine current geopolitical and social contexts, as well as future opportunities for cooperation. Recommendations will be developed for future youth cooperation between Programme and neighboring partner countries, with a focus on programs like Erasmus+ and ESC. 🔗 Application form: http://linktr.ee/zujalica #ZUJALICA #PlatformaZaMlade

I was also part of the AFS program and I went to New Zealand back in 1993. Personally, this experience meant 2 practical changes to me: 1) I became open to change in almost every aspect of my life. When you are far away from home, in a culturally different country, you will always be changing and optimizing day-to-day life. I believe I’m a very adaptative individual towards corporate and entrepreneurial life today because I opened my mind. 2) Critical Thinking: when you are exposed during a whole year/semester to be comparing the good/the bad /the worse of your country towards your host country and viceversa, you definitively develop a critical point of view. Just inagine how lucky you are if you have 3 or more experiences living overseas. I recommend to anyone looking for inspiration, motivation and becoming a better version of themselves.

ANNOUNCEMENT| Round table Webinar| AAJS African Association for Japanese Studies is delighted to invite you to a roundtable webinar themed “Glocalization, Migration and African Scholarship: Exploring the Japan Paradigm” on Saturday, 24th of February 2024, 17:00 WAT on Twitter Spaces (https://lnkd.in/dT7_Pkdr) Tune in to hear five brilliant and highly anticipated young speakers at home and in the diaspora speak on: 1. How the humanities can be strengthened towards being relevant in repositioning Africa in the new world order. 2. What Africa and African Scholarship can do positively to stall migration and its consequences for Africa. 3. What Africa and Africans can learn from Asia, especially Japan, as well as what Africa has to offer Japan. This conversation is crucial as transnationality and glocalization attain greater salience in the post-COVID era. Please, mark your calendar. One of Germany's strengths lies in its foreign policy. Germany recognises the role that foreign cultural and educational policy can play within a society and its cultural heritage 🏛️. Showing a strong commitment to taking responsibility for its role in #colonialism, Germany 🇩🇪 reached an agreement with Nigeria 🇳🇬 on the momentous return of the “Benin Bronzes” which were looted from West Africa during the colonial era in July 2022. Germany’s programme to preserve cultural assets has helped preserve manuscripts from Timbuktu in Mali 🇲🇱, providing 90m euros to over 3600 projects between 1981 and 2021 in 40 years. More on Germany's foreign cultural policy: https://t1p.de/yg34v #Germany #BeninBronzes #Nigeria #ForeignPolicy #CulturalPolicy #EducationalPolicy #WestAfrica #ColonialLegacy #CulturalPartnership #CulturalHeritage #UNESCOWorldHeritageSite #CulturalAssets #Timbuktu #Mali

🇫🇷🇫🇷🇫🇷🇫🇷🇫🇷🇫🇷🇫🇷🇫🇷🇫🇷🇫🇷🇫🇷 Bonne Fête de la Francophonie à tous les Francophones autour du monde. Célébrons La Langue, La Culture et la Littérature Française. 🇫🇷🇫🇷🇫🇷🇫🇷🇫🇷🇫🇷🇫🇷🇫🇷🇫🇷🇫🇷🇫🇷 20th March is the International Francophonie Day 🇫🇷🇫🇷🇫🇷🇫🇷🇫🇷🇫🇷🇫🇷🇫🇷🇫🇷🇫🇷🇫🇷 Story behind the specific date: The date of March 20 was chosen to celebrate the anniversary of the Agency for Cultural and Technical Cooperation (ACCT) that was born on March 20, 1970 in Niamey, Niger. This agency marks the first step towards Francophone cooperation, which will become the International Organization of La Francophonie a little later. The French language has always had an important place among languages. First a symbol of culture and creativity, it was then a vector of democracy and humanism, values that UNESCO intends to promote. UNESCO loves, speaks and promotes French - one of its 6 official languages and one of its 2 working languages. But more broadly UNESCO celebrating the Francophonie celebrates the cultural and linguistic diversity that makes up the world. Celebrating La Francophonie is recognizing the potential of language and culture to unite people, to create spaces of solidarity and mutual understanding, to reflect together on our common future. The United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) and the International Organization of La Francophonie (OIF) share this common vision that places culture and language at the heart of any lasting effort for peace. and development.

[TUOI TRE NEWSPAPER - SPRING EDITION 2024] 📌 INTERNATIONAL ACCREDITATION: CATAPULTING VIETNAM'S EDUCATION IN THE ERA OF INTEGRATION In an interview with Tuoi Tre, Mr. J. David Armstrong, Jr. - Vice President of EQuest Education Group, expressed that Vietnam has made significant strides into the orbit of international integration, currently ranking 59th among countries with the best education systems globally. He emphasized that accreditation will continue to significantly improve the position of Vietnamese education compared to the world and expressed his belief that the time will come when Vietnam will become an attractive destination for international students in the region. This article delves into the story of accreditation in the US, offering insights into both Vietnamese education and EQuest, through the lens of Mr. J. David Armstrong, Jr.'s extensive experience as a long-time education manager in the US. To delve into the details of Mr. J. David Armstrong, Jr.'s insights on international accreditation through the following article here 👉 https://lnkd.in/gKV8RYY8 #EQuest #EQuest_Group #EQuest_Education #EQuest_Education_Group #Accredited #Cognia
